title: Number of missing persons files in the U.S. by race 2019
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of missing persons in each Race on the y axis.
Race White has the highest Number of missing persons and Indian has the lowest Number of missing persons.
The highest Race White has 349321.0 more Number of missing persons than the lowest Race Indian.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of missing persons for 5 number of Races.
Race White has the highest Number of missing persons and Indian has the lowest Number of missing persons.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of missing persons in each Race on the y axis.
Race White has the highest Number of missing persons and Indian has the lowest Number of missing persons.
The highest Race White has 349321.0 more Number of missing persons than the lowest Race Indian.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of missing persons for 5 number of Races.
The maximum Number of missing persons 359768.0 is found at Race White and the minimum is found at Indian where Race is 10447.0.
Race Black has the second highest value for Number of missing persons.
The difference of Number of missing persons between the highest and lowest Race is 349321.0.
Race White is higher than any other Races with value 359768.0, followed by Black, and Unknown. Down to Race Indian with the lowest value 10447.0.
Considered together, the average Number of missing persons in all 5 Races is roughly 121855.0.
The Number of missing persons is 609275.0 if we add up values of all Races.
